trans-unit.source: Contains contextual state information for a designer, such as the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.WorkflowDesigner"></xref>.
This includes permanent state information, such as the list of services running in the designer.
It also includes transient state consisting of context items including the set of currently selected objects as well as the editing tool being used to manipulate objects on the design surface.
The <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.EditingContext> represents the communication boundary that is shared between the hosting application and the [!INCLUDE[wfd1](~/includes/wfd1-md.md)].
The <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.EditingContext> was implemented as a concrete class for ease of use.

Override <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.EditingContext.CreateServiceManager%2A> and <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.EditingContext.CreateContextItemManager%2A> to use customized managers derived from <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.ServiceManager> and <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.ContextItemManager>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.EditingContext"></xref> class.
Creates an instance of the context item manager that is returned by the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.EditingContext.Items"></xref> property.

The default implementation creates a <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.ContextItemManager> that supports delayed activation of design editor managers through the declaration of a <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.SubscribeContextCallback> attribute on the design editor manager.
<xref href="System.Activites.Design.ContextItemManager"></xref>.
Creates an instance of the service manager to be returned from the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.EditingContext.Services"></xref> property.

The default implementation creates a <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.ServiceManager> that supports delayed activation of design editor managers through the declaration of a <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.SubscribeContextCallback> attribute on the design editor manager.
A <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.ServiceManager"></xref> object.
Immediately releases any unmanaged resources used by the object.
Immediately releases the unmanaged resources used by the current <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.EditingContext"></xref> object.
`true` if this object is being disposed of; `false` if the object is finalizing.

Occurs when the <xref href="System.IDisposable.Dispose"></xref> method is called or when the <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.EditingContext"></xref> object is finalized and collected by the garbage collector of the Microsoft .NET common language runtime.
Returns the local collection of context items stored by the current editing context.
The <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.EditingContext.Items%2A> collection is for data that is shared between a host and the designer.
This data provides the mechanism needed to hook into subscription and change notification.
The <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.ContextItemManager"></xref> collection of <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.ContextItem"></xref> objects used in this editing context.
Returns the service manager used in the current editing context.

<xref:System.Activities.Presentation.EditingContext.Services%2A> represent functionality that is either provided by the host for the designer to use or that is used by the designer to make functionality available to all designers within the editor.
The <xref href="System.Activities.Presentation.ServiceManager"></xref> used in this editing context.
